Linking File Revisions to Process Items

If process rules are enforced for a project, linking and pinning new file revisions to a process item is required. Otherwise, this step is optional, and you can select any change request, requirement, or task as a process item.

To link and pin file revisions to the active process item:

  1. From the upper pane, select a file or files to be checked in.

  2. Select File > Check In from the File menu. This action displays the Check In dialog

  3. Complete the initial steps required for a check in. See Checking in Files.

  4. If you have pre-selected a process item, it appears in the Item text box. To accept this item, check the Link and pin process item check box.

  5. If work on the active process item is now complete, select the Mark selected item as fixed/finished/complete check box. If not, go to step 6.

  6. Complete the check-in procedure.

  7. Click OK.

    8. Note: Marking a change request as Fixed immediately changes the responsibility to the name of the user who entered the change request.

To link and pin file revisions to an inactive process item:

  1. From the upper pane, select a file or files to be checked in.

  2. Select File > Check In from the File menu. This action displays the Check In dialog.

  3. Complete the initial steps required for a check in. See Checking in Files.

  4. To insert a process item in the Item text box or replace the currently selected item, select the Link and pin process item check box.

  5. Click Select to open the Select Process Item dialog.

  6. To limit the list of possible process items, select one of the following:

    1. List linked items option button to list the process items that are already linked to at least one of the files you are checking in. No process item appears on the list more than once, even if it is linked to several files. Also, when a process item is linked to more than one file, the dialog displays the name of only one file. Despite this fact, the application will update or create links for every file being added.

    2. List all permitted items option button to display all items that can be used as process items. If process rules are not enforced, the list contains all change requests, all requirements, and all tasks.

    3. List all permitted items assigned to me option button to display all the items for which you are responsible that can be used as process items.

  7. Select the Change Request, Requirement, or Task tab to restrict the list to a specific type of item.

  8. From the list, select a specific item as the active process item.

  9. Click OK. This action returns you to the Check In dialog.

  10. If work on the active process item is now complete, select the Mark Selected Item As Fixed/Finished/Complete check box. If not, go to step 11.

  11. Complete the check-in procedure.

  12. Click OK.

    13. Tip: If process rules are enforced, the use of some change requests, requirements, or tasks as process items may not be permitted, because of their status. If you select such an item and click OK, the application notifies you of this fact. By double-clicking the item in the list box, you can display its properties and change it to a permitted status for a linked process item.
